How come whenever I go into map view and back, the rocket is zoomed out a lot and the game starts zooming it in? Also when I throttle up, I notice the arrow goes a lot more slower to 100%. I am using .23

Edited January 5, 2014 by dreadwave21

Not sure if this is the same issue, but I've been having a weird camera bug as well. Whenever I change vessels through the map view the camera is way off-set from the new active vessel. Double tapping M fixes it fine, but it's a little annoying.

The zooming in is a new feature, and I don't like it because it wastes my already weak computing resources.

Slow throttle up is a bug. Whenever you're on the launch pad, everything slows down. Try to walk a Kerbal around. It's like slow motion.

Maybe it's related to physics settings? I.e. when it's taking too much resources to calculate physics (usually happens with high partcount vehicles) game may either lag or slowdown depending on settings. It can be changed in options from main menu by adjusting slider to the right (slo-mo) or left (laggy).
